messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:15): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: a number of the issues on http://dev.w3.org/html5/status/issue-status.html that are in state "Call for Alternate/Counter Proposals" don't have a deadline
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:15): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: is that intentional?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:16): annevk: i highly recommend writing a CCP for http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html/2011Jan/0239.html -- i'll help out if you want
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:16): is utterly swamped dealing with all these CPs and would really welcome the help
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:21): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, you could assign me to help with some of them if you want, if that's okay with Google.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:22): sure
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:22): the issue-status file is getting really hard to read, with all the issues pending decisions and so on
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:22): and weird issues like -31 that I don't understand the status of
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:31): jgraham, annevk, or whoever: could you figure out what innerText does in Opera and tell me, and also tell me whether there are known compat issues with it?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:32): It seems like it's the simplest possible behavior that won't have serious compat problems.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:33): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Including script elements is the only site compat bug I can find with it
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:34): adds that to his tests
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:34): Oh, wait, it's already there.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:34): What site is the compat problem with?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:35): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: http://dirty.ru
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:38): finds a line of code he'd missed before and has the whole thing start to make sense

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:39): doesn't see where the compat issue comes from, since it doesn't seem to use innerText in Opera except where it uses textContent in Firefox, so does the issue occur in Firefox too?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:39): What were the steps to reproduce?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:40): It's an old bug report, it's entirely possible the site doesn't use it any more
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:41): Yeah, doesn't appear to reproduce any more
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (20:41): I'm still shocked that <devide> in being designed on the level on waht kind of harware bus is being used instead of what type of device is being used
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:42): It's not being "designed", at least.  It was "written in a throwaway proposal by 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e that he put into the spec".

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:43): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: CDATA blocks gets <[!CDATA[‚Ä¶]]> put around them, <br> causes \n, and that's it pretty much. There's some odd code for lastDescendent which may well do broken stuff for innerText.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:44): Weird, why would you need <[!CDATA[...]]> around CDATA blocks?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:45): Actually, how can you even get CDATA blocks in text/html?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (20:46): I didn't think the concept even existed.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:46): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I guess it's become it's what the innerHTML stuff does, pretty much
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:46): But how can you even get a CDATA node in the DOM?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:46): Is it possible from parsing text/html?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:46): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: It's the same code used for both HTML and XML, and {inner,outer}{Text,HTML}.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:47): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: You can get it from DOM manipulation.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:47): Well, I assume there's no compat risk there, so I won't spec it.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:47): I think we output end tags in a few cases with lastDescendent, but that just seems buggy

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (20:48): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: there's nothing in <device> designed to be hardware-bus-related. The stuff in the spec other than "media" is just throwaway filler for the moment (indeed the spec says so somewhere, iirc)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:56): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, do you know how I can actually set the contents of a Selection in Opera?  I can't figure out any way that works.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (20:57): Whatever I do seems to produce selection.rangeCount == 0.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:07): it seems that security experts can't decide which plug-in (Java, Flash Player, Adobe Reader) is the "top" avenue for exploits
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:08): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I'll fix issue-status shortly - setting up new computer at the moment
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:09): cool
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:09): finally, I should have build times less than an hour
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:11): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: thanks for finally deciding issue 41
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:11): you're welcome, though Sam deserves the thanks more than me
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (21:11): http://www.w3.org/2001/tag/2011/02/security-web.html
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (21:11): I am surprised that posting the 41 decision did not spawn a flamewar
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (21:11): http://www.w3.org/2001/tag/2010/10/interaction-examples.html
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:12): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Where's your TC?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:12): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, http://aryeh.name/spec/innertext/innertext.html
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:12): http://aryeh.name/spec/innertext/test/innerText.html
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:13): 1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167: gotta love URLs thathave two years
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (21:13): a decade apart even
1f58faf0d058f303f30239a369808167 (21:14): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: I don't know. I never look at the date as something meaningful. For me there are just identifier.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:14): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I'm confused what you're trying to do there
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:14): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, to do where?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:16): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: You create a range consisting of #test, select that, then collapse in document.body
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:16): I was experimenting.  :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:19): Okay, I don't understand what's going on in that case either.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:19): I'm just creating a Range for what I want to be selected, using removeAllRanges() on the Selection, then adding the range.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (21:19): So that Range should be what's selected.  No?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:19): Yeah.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:19): In simple TCs, it works fine
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:24): Oh well, I'm outta here.
